title: Newburgh Police Department monthly reports required by City Code 80-2

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Newburgh Police Department monthly reports required by City Code 80-2
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. For the time period of January 1, 2020 to the present, all monthly reports submitted by the Chief of Police to the City Council pursuant to Newburgh City Code § 80-2, which states that: 

“[t]he Police Chief shall present to the Council at its first regular meeting in each month a report of the operations of the Department during the preceding month, including therein a statement of the number of persons arrested during such month, their sex, the cause of arrest, the number of persons convicted and such other particulars in relation to that Department as he may deem necessary and proper to communicate." 

A copy of Newburgh City Code § 80-2 is available at this link: https://ecode360.com/10870789

2. Any and all records (whether from the Police Department, City Council, or any other City official, employee, board, office, etc.) reflecting whether the monthly reports required under Newburgh City Code § 80-2 were ever prepared, transmitted, received, discussed, or requested. This includes, but is not limited to:
- Internal and external correspondence concerning such reports;
- Memoranda and emails addressing compliance (or non-compliance) with the reporting obligation under § 80-2;
- Council meeting agendas, minutes, and summaries referencing the monthly reports or their absence;
- All written policies and practices relating to these reporting obligations;
- Any prior FOIL requests, inquiries, complaints, or responses concerning the same.

3. All other reports submitted by the Police Department to the City Council during that same period, or submitted by the Police Department to the City Manager for inclusion in the City Manager's reports to the City Council, regardless of the titles of such reports, or their format, subject matter, and/or frequency. This may include, but is not limited to: annual reports, statistical or operational summaries, special reports, presentations, memoranda, and/or briefings.

This request is made with the understanding that regular reporting by the Police Department is not merely a bureaucratic formality, but a fundamental legal obligation intended to ensure that the City Council has sufficient information to effectively oversee law enforcement operations and ensure that the City is meeting the public safety needs of its residents, businesses, and other taxpayers. If such reports are not being submitted as required—or if the City is unable to produce meaningful documentation that these reports exist or that similar records are being regularly provided to the Council—it would reflect a serious failure of transparency and governance. This is a matter of vital public importance.

If any of the requested records are withheld or redacted, in whole or in part, please specify with particularity the statutory basis for each such claimed exemption and the reasons why each such record or portion thereof is claimed to be exempt from disclosure. If additional information is needed to adequately describe our request, please contact us at liberty@libertystreetlegal.com.
 
Please provide electronic copies of the requested records via email attachment.
 
Thank you for your time and attention to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Liberty Street Legal PLLC

title: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CD of Testimony Taken During US Navy Court of Inquiry into USS Liberty Attack
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was aboard the USS Liberty when the IDF attacked our ship on June 8, 1967 and serve my shipmates as Historian of the USS Liberty Veterans Association.

In June, 1967 the US Navy convened a Court of Inquiry to look into the June 8, 1967 attack on the USS Liberty.

Testimony taken by the court was recorded on a Dictaphone which was later converted to CD.

I am requesting a copy of the CD that contains the testimony before the US Navy Court of Inquiry into the attack on the USS Liberty.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joe Meadors

Our office uses the foia@nara.gov address for FOIA and Privacy Act requests
for the NARA's operational records (records created by this agency).
Because your request is for records that may be archival records (records
created by or originated in a different agency, but that may have been
transferred to the legal custody of NARA), we are forwarding it by this
email to our Office of Research Services, Motion Picture and Sound
branch, which
handles requests for the type of records you seek.

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Untitled (Harrisburg Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information related to the July 4, 2025 Food Truck Festival held in Harrisburg, Pennsylvania on Front Street.
- The audio recording and script of any public announcements played during the event, indicating that "bags are subject to search."
- Documentation showing the location and timing of these announcements (e.g., speaker placement, frequency).
- Any communication concerning the development, authorization, and legal justification for the stated bag search policy and prohibition of ski masks or other face coverings during the event.
- Instructions provided to personnel to conduct or justify searches based on suspicion, behavior, or appearance
- Whether and how Community Service Aides (CSAs) were authorized to participate in or conduct searches
- Any official directives, standard operating procedures, briefings, or training documents provided to personnel outlying authority to conduct searches or enforce face covering policies
- Any public facing materials issued before the event, including press releases, city website updates, social media posts, event signage plans and verbiage, informing the public about bag searches, face covering rules, or related enforcement policies
- Any incident repots, enforcement logs, or field notes documenting actual searches or encounters with individuals during the event, include those stopped for wearing face coverings, bags being search, or appearing "suspicious"

Communication includes any internal or external communication (including email, text messages, memos, meeting notes, call logs, city council meeting notes) within and between the following related to the bag search policy and face covering restriction:
- The City of Harrisburg (including the Mayor’s Office, City Council, and all municipal departments)
- The Harrisburg Bureau of Police
- The Pennsylvania State Police (PSP)
- The Dauphin County District Attorney’s Office
- Any Dauphin County government offices
- Any Pennsylvania state government departments or officials
- Any Federal government agencies, law enforcement, or intelligence agency

Provide the requested records electronically if available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sebastian Sibrand

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDA on lecanemab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

July 15, 2025
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

RE:  Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, I am requesting all FDA FAERS case  reports, including the narrative and summary reports on the two drugs below:
1.)  lecanemab aka: lecanemab-IRMB or Leqembi  for all times up to the most recent entries.
2.)  donanemab, aka donanemab-AZBT or Kisunla for all times up to the most recent entries.

I'm also requesting case report number 24075739 regarding a patient on lecanemab who experience “confusion”.

I am a professional journalist writing on commission for The BMJ and The Lever.
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer

communications.subject: Welcome to the Fulton County Open Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Dillon Bergin: 
Thank you for registering with the Fulton County Open Records Center. 
 
Please log in to the Records Center here with your email address (https://fultoncountyga.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/(S(tyu2oqbwkxi5xdvoqhcxortb))/supporthome.aspx) 189648-76685570@requests.muckrock.com where you can do the following: 
 
·    Set up an open records account 
·    Submit an open records request 
·    Track the progress of your open records request 
·    Receive records responsive to your request 
·    Communicate with the Open Records Team about your request 
·    Review previous open records requests 
·    View frequently asked questions about the Open Records Act 
 
 
If you have never used this system before or cannot remember your current password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://fultoncountyga.mycusthelp.com/webapp/_rs/forgotpassword.aspx) The following Fulton County departments are custodians of their own records: Please note: 
 
·    District Attorney's Office 
·    Police Department 
·    Probate Court 
·    Sheriff's Office 
·    State Court 
·    Superior Court and Magistrate Court 
 
To find out how to submit your open records requests to these particular departments and for additional information, please click here then scroll down to the Fulton County Open Records Custodians drop-down menu, then select the department you would like to submit your request to. (https://www.fultoncountyga.gov/inside-fulton-county/fulton-county-departments/office-of-the-county-attorney/open-records-requests) 
 
If you have any additional questions, please respond to this message so that a member of the Open Records Team can assist you further. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Fulton County Open Records Team 
E: orr@fultoncountyga.gov (mailto:orr@fultoncountyga.gov) 
P: (404) 612-0281 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

Dear Dillon Bergin: 
 
Thank you for submitting an open records request to Fulton County, Georgia. 
 
The County received your open records request dated July 15, 2025 and has assigned the reference number R009805-071525 for tracking purposes. 
Record(s) Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

We will assign your request to the appropriate department(s) and notify you in advance if there is a cost associated with your request prior to proceeding with it.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bernard Kordan (1921-2012)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of all documents on, about or mentioning Bernard Kordan, including ELSUR and cross-reference documents. Please search in particular for field notes, agent's notes, memoranda, correspondence, and reports of investigations, and for documents relating to the FBI Responsibilities Program, FBI Dissemination of Information Policy, FBI Counterintelligence Program ("COINTELPRO"), and FBI blacklisting of school teachers, college professors, and other public employees between 1950 and 1969.

Name of individual: Bernard Kordan
Date of birth: April 5 1921
Place of birth: St. Louis, MO
Occupation: Medical Doctor, Doctor of Radiology
Institutions:
- Studied at University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA), Los Angeles CA

Spouse: Mildred ("Millie") Jessica Harris (DOB December 15 1920)
Brother: Herbert Allen Kordan (DOB April 10 1926, DOD October 11 2021)

Previous addresses, including but not limited to:
- 2728 Malabar St, Los Angeles, CA
- 10954 Ophir Drive (Apt A4), Los Angeles, CA
- San Francisco, CA

I am also providing the following documents to aid in identification:

- Link to online obituary of Bernard Kordan:
https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/bakersfield/name/bernard-kordan-obituary?id=19529983

- FBI reference: File number 116-SF-48053

- According to a document addressed to the Director of the FBI and dated February 27 1963 concerning an investigation into Bernard's brother Herbert Allen Kordan, Bernard Kordan is the subject of FBI file "140-1957". This document was released by NARA as part of my Freedom of Information Access Request submitted concerning Herbert Allen Kordan on February 26 2025 and completed July 1 2025 (quote number: QO1-975064223). Death certificate of Herbert Allen Kordan is attached for reference.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dawn Kordan

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dawn Kordan

title: ALPR audit (St. Louis County Department Of Transportation And Public Works)

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: ALPR audit (St. Louis County Department Of Transportation And Public Works)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Scott Kampas
